intro: Ervatamia wenzelii, commonly known as the Wenzel's ervatamia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is known for its aromatic properties. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
